problem.markdown:
>>Referencing special probability distributions, a single biased coin, where the probability of heads or tails is not necessarily one half, which of the following distribution would best model the outcome? <<
( ) Binomial Random Variable (x) Bernoulli Random Variable ( ) Geometrically distributed random variable ( ) None of the above
[Explanation] The binomial distribution is the sum of independent and identically distributed Bernoulli random variables. For one coin toss, you would only need a Bernoulli distribution as there are only two possible outcomes. The geometric distribution is not appropriate because you would be modeling the latest time you expect to see one outcome. [Explanation]
